page.title: 16MOBILE LIBRARY IN MILDENHALL
page.content: The{mobile library service}to the villages around Marlborough has been operating since 1959.The van is well equipped for its task.It is a 28 foot Bedford van with 2,823 books, to cater for all tastes.The current annual cost of running the van is Â£3,250.Every two weeks the van visits places which are too small and isolated to have a permanent library.On a typical day in the Kennet valley area the van travels 40 miles, stopping in all the villages such as Mildenhall and Axford. Unfortunately only about 30% of the people in the villages use the library.People questioned in Axford and Mildenhall said they were too old to get to the van's stopping place, or were too busy with young children to read.However many people appreciated the social contact provided by the service.
